Other methods

Methods we haven’t used as much, but should use more!

Content testing

When to use? You’re trying to understand how well your words work for people

How to get started? Most content testing is a derivation of usability testing. Read our usability testing tips first. Then read 18F’s introduction to content testing techniques.

Card sorting

When to use? When you’re trying to create or test organization schemes

How to get started? Read Usability.gov’s introduce to card sorting.

Multivariate testing

When to use? Use to test how multiple versions of an interface affect a metric of interest

How to get started? Talk to the platforms team and read this introduction to multivariate testing.

Observation

When to use? When you need to better understand the context in which people work

How to get started? Read UXMatters introduction to participant observation.
